meanings.definition: A person who incorporates something, especially a business or organization.
meanings.sent1: The incorporator filed the necessary paperwork to establish the new company.
meanings.sent2: The incorporator played a crucial role in setting up the non-profit organization.
meanings.sent3: The clever incorporator made sure the business had all the right documents in place.
meanings.sent4: She was like an incorporator of ideas, bringing together different concepts to create a successful project.
meanings.sent5: The diligent incorporator carefully merged the different departments into a unified structure.

meanings.sent1: As an incorporator, he was responsible for establishing the legal entity of the corporation.
meanings.sent2: The incorporator worked closely with lawyers to ensure the proper formation of the corporation.
meanings.sent3: The humorous incorporator joked that forming a corporation felt like playing a giant game of Monopoly.
meanings.sent4: She was the master incorporator, molding the corporation into a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The visionary incorporator built the corporation from the ground up, turning dreams into reality.
